subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: Better check with these guys.
author: Zack Widup
full_text:
So we could call ourselves Ghost Boxers (not to be confused with Shadow 
Boxers).
;-)

Zack

On Thu, 9 Oct 2008, M.A. Coletta (Mike) wrote:

> In my eyes we are all Ghost Boxologists, and all equal.
> That is why I coined the phrases:
>
> Ghost Box-ology (Ghost Boxology) - The study of Ghost Boxes including
> the art/science of design, test, instruction, and performance.
>
> Ghost Box-ologist (Ghost Boxologist) - One who practices the
> art/science of Ghost Boxology.
>
> There is no right way, or wrong way... there are just ways.
> Who knows what the spirits or entities like best?  I'm sure there are
> a number of methods that work well for them, and us.. and we are
> always attempting new ways. Some work and some don't... or not at
> first maybe.
>
> Frank's Box, the Radio Shack Hack(s), the Mini Box, Joe's Box, etc.
> are all methods that use sweeping audio.  And others are coming up
> with new ideas all the time.
> The Ovilus and Puck for example.  Even though Bill Chappell says
> those methods are just for entertainment, I'm sure there will be
> times when things happen when using those devices that make one
> wonder.
> (Note: I don't have a Frank's Box, Mini Box, or Joe's Box, but I hear
> they all work well.)
>
> It's really great to have people (Ghost Boxologists) that are willing
> to share their information and ideas.  Recently I've read some posts
> about another method using a chamber, switch, etc. for an audio type
> device.  That's awesome that there is still a desire to try new stuff.
>
> I too am working on something new, right now in the test phase, and
> I'll be sharing that in the near (or far) future.
> I'm also going to attempt to 'crack' that other radio again, even
> though it might not be possible.
>
> Thanks to all who keep this Ghost Boxology effort going!
>
> - Mike (UFO Geek)
